blocks.title: Literature review
blocks.description: Perform a literature review on EST systems. Tabulate the explored systems in terms of essential storage characteristics, such as storage duration, storage capacity and system size.
links: The energy transition: an engineering challenge

blocks.title: Supply & demand analysis
blocks.description: Install the Simulink EST model and use it to analyze the supply and demand signals. Define requirements for the EST system, such as storage duration and storage capacity.

blocks.title: Toolbox exploration
blocks.description: Explore the experimental toolboxes during your lab session.

blocks.title: Conceptual idea
blocks.description: Develop the conceptual idea of a sustainable and innovative EST system, which is compatible with the requirements following from the supply and demand.

blocks.title: Validation idea
blocks.description: Develop a conceptual idea for the validation experiment. Describe what physical law is to be validated and explain its position in the overall validation process. Specify with which toolbox the experiment can be realized.

blocks.title: Component specification
blocks.description: Specify all relevant components of the EST system, that is: the injection, the extraction, the actual storage, and the transport to and from the storage. Make sure that all components are realistic in relation to the real-world setting of the EST system.

blocks.title: Physical phenomena identification
blocks.description: Identify the physical phenomena that are (most) relevant for the chosen system and its sub-components.

blocks.title: Physical laws exploration
blocks.description: Explore physical laws for the relevant physical phenomena, and select model components with a relevant level of complexity to adequately describe the phenomena. Be aware of the assumptions and simplifications and their effect on the outcome.

blocks.title: Measurement specification
blocks.description: Specify what needs to be measured by the experiment to validate the considered physical law. Explore the components and sensors required for the experimental setup and study how they should connect to each other.

blocks.title: Parameter determination
blocks.description: Determine the parameters of all components (dimensions, material properties, etc.) of your real-world EST system that are required for the model.

blocks.title: Mathematical elaboration
blocks.description: Study the energy flow structure of the Simulink computer model and elaborate the mathematical models describing the physical phenomena such that they fit in this structure.

blocks.title: Setup design
blocks.description: Make a design of the setup in the form of a schematic in which all components and sensors are identified. Make electronic diagrams in which the wiring of the sensors is explained. Investigate what Arduino code needs to be developed to acquire the data from the sensors.

blocks.title: Safety assessment
blocks.description: Perform the mandatory safety self assessment for your envisioned experiments.

blocks.title: Concept infographic
blocks.description: Create a concept infographic that serves as a good basis for the professional infographic required by the end of the project. Make sure that the infographic gives a general overview of the system (components, flow of energy, etc.) and provides technical details (dimensions, powers, etc.). Also make sure that the system parameters used by the model are identifiable in the infographic.

blocks.title: Simulink implementation
blocks.description: Implement the elaborated mathematical model in Simulink. Test your code and make sure it works correctly for the parameters values of your real-world EST system.

blocks.title: Setup assembly
blocks.description: Assemble your setup on the click board. Make sure that everything fits and connects well and that the setup looks neat. Make pictures of the assembled setup in the SOP.

blocks.title: Conduct first measurement
blocks.description: Prepare the first version of your measurement plan, describing the steps required to execute your experiment. Perform the measurement using your assembled setup. Reflect on whether another group would be able to repeat your experiment based on your measurement plan, and adjust it if necessary.

blocks.title: Finalize system parameters
blocks.description: Finalize and tabulate the values of all system parameters corresponding to the reference design of your EST system. These parameters serve as the input for the model results.

blocks.title: Simulation results
blocks.description: Generate results using the Simulink model to demonstrate that it is capable of assessing the performance of the real-world system. Interpret the results and explain how the model can be used to support optimization of the essential system parameters.

blocks.title: Reproducibility session
blocks.description: Prepare your setup on the click board at the start of the reproducibility session. Conduct the experiment of another group (as assigned to you) and evaluate their experiment and SOP based on the provided rubric. Provide motivated feedback to the other group and reflect on the feedback provided to you.

blocks.title: Propose design variations
blocks.description: Propose three design variations (compared to the reference EST system) and motivate why these alternative designs are interesting to study. Define and tabulate the values of all system parameters corresponding to the three design variations. Make sure that the proposed variations clearly differ.

blocks.title: Simulink finalization
blocks.description: Finalize your Simulink implementation. Test your code rigorously to make sure that the physical phenomena are described correctly and that the model runs stably for the proposed design variations.

blocks.title: Simulation results
blocks.description: Based on the specification of all essential model parameters for the reference design, generate detailed simulation results based on which the performance of the EST system is assessed. Also simulate the proposed design variations using the developed model. Assess the performance of the EST system variations, paying attention to the validity of the results.

blocks.title: Measurement codes
blocks.description: Develop the codes for the gathering and post-processing of the experimental data.

blocks.title: Step-by-step measurement plan
blocks.description: Create a measurement plan describing the steps required to execute your experiment and how to gather your experimental data. Include details regarding relevant sensor calibration steps.

blocks.title: Conduct measurements
blocks.description: Conduct experiments in accordance with the step-by-step measurement plan. Use the Arduino and post-processing scripts to visualize the experimental results. Make sure to perform the measurement multiple times and visualize the measurement uncertainty in the results.

blocks.title: Compare design variations
blocks.description: Compare the design variations making use of the simulation results. Based on this comparison, draw conclusions and formulate suggestions for improvement regarding the suitability of the proposed EST system.

blocks.title: Infographic finalization
blocks.description: Finalize the infographic based on the feedback received on the interim version. Make sure that the infographic is tailored to the interests of a panel of experts.

blocks.title: Modeling process reflection
blocks.description: Reflect on the model development process by explaining the capabilities and limitations of your Simulink model, the relation between the validation process and the real-world EST Simulink model, and by discussion the lessons learned throughout the project.

blocks.title: Validity assessment
blocks.description: Assess the validity of the considered physical law by comparing the experimental results with those based on the theory.

blocks.title: Demonstration session
blocks.description: At the start of the demo session, assemble the finalized version of your setup on the click board. Make sure that everything fits and connects well and that the setup looks neat. Make sure that the electronics and the software are ready to gather the experimental data and that safety precautions are taken into account. Demonstrate your validation experiment following the step-by-step measurement plan. Explain the quality of the gathered data in terms of resolution, range, sampling frequency etc. Show the postprocessing of the experimental data, with attention for repeatability and accuracy. After the demo, neatly disassemble your setup, clean the components, and return the toolbox in its original state.
